Description:
ANDARD MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSEducation:Completion of secondary school education, preferably supplemented with a university degree in Economics, social sciences, project management. Relevant certificates on gender, protection, inclusion, accountability to affected people programming and monitoring will be an asset. Experience:Minimum five years of relevant working experience in Humanitarian and Development programming including cross-cutting themes. Knowledge & Skills:Database management and analytical skills
Good understanding of on gender, protection and accountability to affected people policies, including WFP Policy. 
Good communication and negotiation skills
Good understanding of gender equality and women empowerment workstreams
Good understanding of Age, gender and diversity mainstreaming.
Good skills on Microsoft offices: World, PowerPoint, Excel sheet.  Language:Fluency in both spoken and written communication in Arabic and English is a requirement. Proficiency in French at an intermediate level is expected, and knowledge of Spanish is considered an asset.Job Details
